course_title: The Role of the Teacher in Guidance

63A.comments: This is a core course for a Minor in Education, Interpersonal Development and for the Diploma in Education - Guidance Studies.This is an elective course for the Certificate in Health  and  Wellness.Registration is restricted to students in the Faculty of Education for the first three weeks of registration.The registration restrictions will be removed July 30, 2020.Registration will be blocked when all the seats are filled.A waitlist is available for this course - CNPS 426 W3A.

W3A.comments: Waitlist for CNPS 426.Waitlist registration is restricted to students in the Faculty of Education for the first three weeks of registration.Waitlist works on a priority basis.Students in the Faculty of Education (DEDU, EDUC or UNCL) as well as BA MIN EDUC EMP INDV will be registered in the course before any other students.Students are moved from the waitlist into the course ONCE PER DAY.

description: This course is designed to assist the teacher in understanding and using guidance techniques for day-to-day use in the classroom. The emphasis will be on techniques for working with people towards better self-understanding and better perspectives of alternatives.
